notFound.title: Page Not Found
notFound.textDescription: The Page you are looking for doesn't exist or an other error occured.

index.title: About
index.textAbout: software developer with 5 years of experience, specialized in Vue.js and familiar with Angular, with a solid foundation in modern web technologies. I’ve worked on large-scale projects, delivering intuitive, responsive, and high-performance interfaces, always aligned with best practices in usability and accessibility. I have experience working in agile environments, collaborating with cross-functional teams where quick adaptation and continuous delivery are essential. I’m proactive, flexible in the face of changing requirements, and quick to learn new technologies when needed.

vue.description: Vue is a progressive framework for building user interfaces.

angular.description: Angular is a platform for building mobile and desktop web applications.

nuxt.description: Nuxt.js is a framework for building server-rendered Vue applications.

javascript.description: JavaScript is a lightweight, interpreted, or just-in-time compiled programming language with first-class functions.

typescript.description: TypeScript is a typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript.

nestjs.description: Nest is a framework for building efficient, scalable Node.js server-side applications.

spring.description: Spring is a framework for building enterprise applications in Java.

docker.description: Docker is a set of platform as a service products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers.

aws.description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a subsidiary of Amazon that provides on-demand cloud computing platforms and APIs to individuals, companies, and governments, on a pay-as-you-go basis.

git.description: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

sass.description: Sass is a stylesheet language that is compiled to CSS. It allows you to use variables, nested rules, mixins, functions, and more, all with a fully CSS-compatible syntax.

linux.description: Linux is a family of open-source Unix-like operating systems based on the Linux kernel, an operating system kernel first released on September 17, 1991.
